item.title: [Optional] R Basics 1
item.description: 👋 Welcome Welcome to to the course! This is the first of 2 sets of exercises introducing you to the R programming language1 that we will use throughout the course. This and the next lesson are optional. Their intended for you if you are not that familiar with R, or you would like to practice your R basics before getting started. 📝 Lesson Preview Set up R and RStudio

item.title: [Optional] R Basics 2
item.description: Lesson Preview Functions Control Flow if statements for loops apply() Parallel computation Functions If objects are the nouns of the R language, functions are the verbs. They do things to objects. Let’s use the mean function as an example. This function takes the mean of a numeric vector object. Remember our numeric_vector object from Lesson 1: numeric_vector <- c(2.
